events.originalText: Severe flooding and mudslides on the island of Madeira, Portugal, killed 51 people.
events.subtitle: 2010 Madeira floods and mudslides
events.headline: Severe flooding in Madeira, Portugal kills 51

events.originalText: The Tamil Tigers attempted to crash two aircraft laden with C-4 in suicide attacks on Colombo, Sri Lanka, but the planes were shot down before they reached their targets.
events.subtitle: Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam
events.headline: Tamil Tigers fail in suicide attack on Colombo, Sri Lanka

events.originalText: At the age of 15, American figure skater Tara Lipinski became the youngest gold-medal winner in the history of the Winter Olympic Games at the time.
events.subtitle: Figure skating
events.headline: American figure skater Tara Lipinski wins gold at Winter Olympics at 15

events.originalText: Appearing on the talk show Larry King Live, U.S. industrialist Ross Perot announced that he would begin a presidential campaign if "ordinary people" wanted him to run for office.
events.subtitle: Larry King Live
events.headline: Ross Perot considers presidential campaign on Larry King Live

events.originalText: The Nagorno-Karabakh Autonomous Oblast voted to secede from Azerbaijan and join Armenia, triggering the First Nagorno-Karabakh War.
events.subtitle: Nagorno-Karabakh Autonomous Oblast
events.headline: Nagorno-Karabakh Autonomous Oblast votes to secede from Azerbaijan

events.originalText: The Wat Phra Dhammakaya in Pathum Thani province, one of the largest Buddhist temples in Thailand, was founded.
events.subtitle: Wat Phra Dhammakaya
events.headline: Wat Phra Dhammakaya temple founded in Pathum Thani, Thailand

events.originalText: The NASA spacecraft Ranger 8 spacecraft transmitted 7,137 photographs of the Moon in the final 23 minutes of its mission before crashing as planned in Mare Tranquillitatis.
events.subtitle: Ranger 8
events.headline: NASA spacecraft Ranger 8 transmits photos of Moon before crashing

events.originalText: Canadian prime minister John Diefenbaker cancelled the Avro CF-105 Arrow (pictured) interceptor-aircraft program amid much political debate.
events.subtitle: John Diefenbaker
events.headline: Canadian PM cancels Avro CF-105 Arrow program

events.originalText: The Saturday Evening Post published the first of Norman Rockwell's Four Freedoms, among the most widely distributed paintings ever produced, in support of U.S. president Franklin Roosevelt's Four Freedoms.
events.subtitle: The Saturday Evening Post
events.headline: Norman Rockwell's Four Freedoms painting published in Saturday Evening Post

events.originalText: A fissure opened in a cornfield in the Mexican state of Michoacán and continued to erupt for nine years, forming the cinder cone Parícutin .
events.subtitle: Fissure vent
events.headline: Parícutin cinder cone forms in Mexican cornfield

events.originalText: Paraguayan anarchists briefly seized the city of Encarnación as part of a larger plan to initiate a social revolution in the country.
events.subtitle: Taking of Encarnación
events.headline: Paraguayan anarchists briefly seize city of Encarnación

events.originalText: The Supreme Court of the United States ruled in Jacobson v. Massachusetts that states had the authority to order compulsory vaccination.
events.subtitle: Supreme Court of the United States
events.headline: US Supreme Court rules on compulsory vaccination in Jacobson v. Massachusetts

events.originalText: The Metropolitan Museum of Art , today the largest art museum in the United States with a collection of more than two million works, opened in New York.
events.subtitle: Metropolitan Museum of Art
events.headline: Metropolitan Museum of Art opens in New York

events.originalText: American Civil War: The Union Army suffered a one-in-three casualty rate at the Battle of Olustee near Lake City, Florida.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Union Army suffers high casualties at Battle of Olustee in Florida

events.originalText: Polish insurgents in the Free City of Kraków led an uprising attempting to incite a fight for national independence that was put down by the Austrian Empire nine days later.
events.subtitle: Free City of Cracow
events.headline: Polish insurgents uprising in Free City of Kraków suppressed by Austrian Empire

events.originalText: An earthquake registering approximately 8.5 Mw devastated Concepción, Chile, and triggered a tsunami that destroyed neighbouring Talcahuano.
events.subtitle: 1835 Concepción earthquake
events.headline: Earthquake devastates Concepción, Chile triggering tsunami

events.originalText: Italian composer Gioachino Rossini's opera buffa The Barber of Seville premiered at the Teatro Argentina in Rome to jeers from the audience.
events.subtitle: Gioachino Rossini
events.headline: Rossini's The Barber of Seville premieres in Rome

events.originalText: The French colonization of Texas began with the landing of colonists led by Robert de La Salle near Matagorda Bay.
events.subtitle: French colonization of Texas
events.headline: French colonization of Texas begins near Matagorda Bay
